page.title: 09Housing on Papa Stour.
page.content: In the past there were many houses on Papa Stour,but only 10 are inhabited now.They are alike in that they face East,with no doors on the West side because of the prevailing Westerly winds. All the houses on the island are built of stone and mortar,many are rendered and white-washed.Most houses have tarred roofs,and in summer-time you can see men on the roofs tarring. To make this job easier the roofs have a flat apex to walk along. Most of the houses started as a single story but were extended up- wards to provide more bedrooms.Only half of the houses have bathrooms. All of the houses on the island are croft houses except the school-house, which is a council house.The only public buildings are the kirk and the school and the shed at the pier!
